body: I think patch is fine. My only qualm is that moving it out of contrib and into src/bin will make merging PostgreSQL commits harder and make it a bit counter intuitive.
@atris are you sure that pgbench is under contrib in postgres? I just checked postgres repo and it seems pgbench is already under src/bin in postgres!
!! Please hold off on committing this change until after the Beta. Ambari HAWQ plugin will not be able to accommodate these changes for the Beta release. !!
@denalex  Ok, this commit is in, I will revert it.

Fine for me
 +1
Please make sure that tests pass when run multiple times. Preferably tested in a buildfarm
We were seeing transient failures for gp_optimizer earlier on hence the request
The fix looks good to me. +1

The overall fix is good. +1
Why we have gpssh-exkeys and clsAddMirrors.py in Makefile as they are deprecated?
The fix is good to me. +1
It is good to follow the same naming convention.
@denalex Please let me know if this change can be pushed in now since beta is released. Thanks.
Would be useful if we can mention the higher level changes in the jira HAWQ-175 for future reference.

I suggest that the error message we should directly tell user what should be. 
For example: 
ERROR: the values of memory_limit_cluster and core_limit_cluster are not identical
->
ERROR: the values of memory_limit_cluster and core_limit_cluster should be identical

ERROR: active_statements is less than 1
->
ERROR: active_statements should be greater than 1

nvseg_upper_limit_perseg is less than nvseg_lower_limit_perseg
->
nvseg_upper_limit_perseg should be greater than nvseg_lower_limit_perseg
2. Is it any reason we remove 64MB  for vseg_resource_quota?
1. drop a queue having at least one child queue.
   What about change the message to "resource queue %s has at least one chile queue."
The change looks good to me.
+1 The code looks good to me.
The improvement regarding testability for resource manager looks good. +1
The fix looks good to me. +1
+1 The code is good to me.
+1. Make sure doc is updated with this api.

Thanks for your contribution. 

You have to first file a JIRA, describe the issue and/or the motivation. And then commit your change locally. Please follow the commit message style, which begin with JIRA number and a dot and a space. And then start the pull request.

For this pull request. You can file a jira now to describe you problem. And then update your pull request.

+1, I also filed a JIRA for feature request to use the delimiter supplied in FORMAT for CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE DDL.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HAWQ-206
If you want to contribute to that, please add @hornn as reviewer.
The overall fix is good to me. +1
+1 The change looks good to me.
+1 The change looks good to me.
